summary.content: Apple’s fall product announcement begins at 10am PST; 1pm EST. My guesses? Definitely: Next-gen iPhone 5S, iOS 7, OS X Mavericks, iTunes 11 (with iTunes Radio), updated MacBook Pro. Maybe: New iPads (though I’d bet on spring instead), lower unsubsidized-cost iPhone for other (non-American) countries, updated iMac, updated Thunderbolt 2 display (with USB 3.0). Not a chance: An HDTV, a wrist-watch, a pull-string-to-talk Steve Jobs doll. How’d I do? How good were my predictions?

content.tableOfContents:
• My guesses?
  • How’d I do?
content.html:
Apple’s fall product announcement begins at 10am PST; 1pm EST.

My guesses?

  • Definitely: Next-gen iPhone 5S, iOS 7, OS X Mavericks, iTunes 11 (with iTunes Radio), updated MacBook Pro.

  • Maybe: New iPads (though I’d bet on spring instead), lower unsubsidized-cost iPhone for other (non-American) countries, updated iMac, updated Thunderbolt 2 display (with USB 3.0).

  • Not a chance: An HDTV, a wrist-watch, a pull-string-to-talk Steve Jobs doll.

How’d I do?

How good were my predictions? Well, this event was a little shorter than I was expecting and they only covered iPhone-related stuff.

  • Next-gen iPhone 5S. Check.

  • iOS 7. Check.

  • iTunes Radio. Sort-of. It got coverage on the website, but not the event.

  • Lower unsubsidized-cost iPhone for other (non-American) countries. I’m going to say I was wrong. Instead, Apple changed their strategy and created a slightly-modified iPhone 5 called the 5c.

  • New MacBook Pro. I was also wrong here.

My guesses?   Definitely: Next-gen iPhone 5S, iOS 7, OS X Mavericks, iTunes 11 (with iTunes Radio), updated MacBook Pro.
  Maybe: New iPads (though I’d bet on spring instead), lower unsubsidized-cost iPhone for other (non-American) countries, updated iMac, updated Thunderbolt 2 display (with USB 3.0).
  Not a chance: An HDTV, a wrist-watch, a pull-string-to-talk Steve Jobs doll.
  How’d I do? How good were my predictions? Well, this event was a little shorter than I was expecting and they only covered iPhone-related stuff.
  Next-gen iPhone 5S. Check.
  iOS 7. Check.
  iTunes Radio. Sort-of. It got coverage on the website, but not the event.
  Lower unsubsidized-cost iPhone for other (non-American) countries. I’m going to say I was wrong. Instead, Apple changed their strategy and created a slightly-modified iPhone 5 called the 5c.
  New MacBook Pro. I was also wrong here.
content.source:
Apple’s [fall product announcement]({{% wayback "http://live.theverge.com/apple-iphone-5s-liveblog/" %}}) begins at 10am PST; 1pm EST.

## My guesses?

* **Definitely:** Next-gen iPhone 5S, iOS 7, OS X Mavericks, iTunes 11 (with iTunes Radio), updated MacBook Pro.

* **Maybe:** New iPads (though I’d bet on spring instead), lower unsubsidized-cost iPhone for other (non-American) countries, updated iMac, updated Thunderbolt 2 display (with USB 3.0).

* **Not a chance:** An HDTV, a wrist-watch, a pull-string-to-talk Steve Jobs doll.

## How’d I do?

How good were my predictions? Well, this event was a little shorter than I was expecting and they only covered iPhone-related stuff.

* Next-gen [iPhone 5S]({{% wayback "http://www.apple.com/iphone-5s/" %}}). Check.

* [iOS 7]({{% wayback "http://www.apple.com/ios/" %}}). Check.

* [iTunes Radio]({{% wayback "http://www.apple.com/itunes/itunes-radio/" %}}). Sort-of. It got coverage on the website, but not the event.

* [Lower unsubsidized-cost iPhone]({{% wayback "http://www.apple.com/iphone-5c/" %}}) for other (non-American) countries. I’m going to say I was wrong. Instead, Apple changed their strategy and created a slightly-modified iPhone 5 called the *5c*.

* New MacBook Pro. I was also wrong here.

prev.title: Stephen Elop to become the next Microsoft CEO? I’d buy it.
